item.title: Who wants what and why? The original meaning of a user story
item.description: We have all seen them. Gigantic Jira user stories, filled with extensive specification, a truckload of screens for every conceivable device type and a list of things that are supposed to be acceptance criteria. But, regardless of all the available information, in the end the programmed solution deviates significantly from what the stakeholder really wanted. How is this possible? Why does this happen? How can we do better?
